Albania: First Balkan War: The Treaty of London ended the war. Second Balkan War: The war began. Second Balkan War: The Treaty of Bucharest ended the war and recognized an independent Albanian state ruled by a constitutional monarchy.
Australia: The foundation stone for the city of Canberra is put in place Canberra is officially named as the Capital of Australia. 1913 Australian federal election: Joseph Cook elected as the 6th Prime Minister of Australia.
Bangladesh: Establishment of Ahmadiyya Muslim Community Bangladesh in Brahmanbaria
Belgium: Exposition universelle et internationale (1913), World's Fair in Ghent.
Brazil: Roosevelt–Rondon Scientific Expedition: Following a speaking tour in Brazil and Argentina, former US President Theodore Roosevelt meets up with Cândido Rondon to embark on a joint exploration of the "River of Doubt".
China: Assassination of Song Jiaoren: Song Jiaoren, founder of the KMT was assassinated, most likely by then-president Yuan Shikai.
Cuba: The presidency of Mario García Menocal begins.
East_Timor: The Portuguese and Dutch agreed to a formal division of the island.
France: Raymond Poincaré began his term as president of France.
Germany: Saverne Affair: Two local Saverne papers reported on offensive comments made by a local Prussian military officer.
Haiti:
President Auguste dies during a visit to northern Haiti
Senator Michel Oreste is elected president by the Constituent Assembly
India:
Gadar Party formed.
Rabindranath Tagore won Nobel Prize in Literature
Ireland: A Dublin businessman, William Martin Murphy, fires forty workers he suspects belong to the Irish Transport and General Workers' Union (ITGWU). A resulting strike and related civil unrest, the Dublin Lockout, lasts from August 1913 to January 1914.
Philippine: Newton W. Gilbert appointed as acting Civil Governor (1913)
Francis Burton Harrison appointed as Civil Governor (1913–1921)
Singapore: The Singapore Harbour board was set up.
Slovenia: Celje is electrified. Westen's dishes factory uses electricity in industry. Ivan Cankar in Ljubljana gives a speech Slovenes and Yugoslavs for the socialist society Vzajemnost (Mutuality) about Slovenes to unite politically but not culturally with other South Slavs and Yugoslavism.
Taiwan:
Japanese forces engage in a campaign bring aboriginals on the east coast under government control 
Hakka people rebel in Miaoli and are defeated
